1.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

2.text: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

3.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.

4.text: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

5.text: Who hath laid the measures of it, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?

6.text: Upon what are the foundations of it fastened? or who laid its corner stone;

7.text: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.text: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?

9.text: When I made a cloud its garment, and thick darkness a swaddling band for it,

10.text: And broke up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,

11.text: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed.

12.text: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the day-spring to know its place;

13.text: That it might take hold of the ends of earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?

14.text: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.

15.text: And from the wicked their light is withheld, and the high arm shall be broken.

16.text: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?

17.text: Have the gates of death been opened to thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shades of death?

18.text: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.

19.text: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is its place,

20.text: That thou shouldest take it to its bound, and that thou shouldest know the paths to its house?

21.text: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?

22.text: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,

23.text: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

24.text: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?

25.text: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;

26.text: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness in which there is no man;

27.text: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

28.text: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of the dew?

29.text: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

30.text: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

31.text: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

32.text: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in its season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with its sons?

33.text: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set its dominion on the earth?

34.text: Canst thou lift thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

35.text: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say to thee, Here we are?

36.text: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?

37.text: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

38.text: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?

39.text: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,

40.text: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

41.text: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry to God, they wander for want of food.
